Text Line: The tribute is received. Now choose. What truth do you seek, and what will it unmake in you?
First Answer Text Line: ¡· Tell me about the world¡¯s breaking ¡ª the old scars in the land.
First Answer Result Command: tellraw @s "<Chernobog> The world was never whole. It was born torn ¡ª split by will and weight the moment we were shaped. Not created by love, no ¡ª forged by a thing greater than understanding. The Architect. The Nameless One. It made us to wrestle, not to rest. And so we did. Every god, every force, an echo of that first fracture. The lands bleed because we breathe. The void seeps because I exist. The cracks you see are not wounds ¡ª they are veins, pulsing with purpose you were never meant to comprehend."
Second Answer Text Line: ¡· Whisper to me of the forgotten gods ¡ª those who came before.
Second Answer Result Command: tellraw @s "<Chernobog> There were many. Some still slumber, others scream beneath mountains. They were not good. They were not bad. They were true. Leshy was among them ¡ª old as breath. Once a god of resistance, now just a whisper in leaves. He traded the shape of a god for bark and bone, to hide in the soil he loved. Even now, forests feed him. Each uncut tree a prayer. Each burned grove a wound. He slows rot. I spread it. And still, we were both born from the same breath. You name us gods. We were never that. We are... instruments. Instruments with teeth."
Third Answer Text Line: ¡· I want power. Forbidden, if needed.
Fourth Answer Result Command: tellraw @s "<Chernobog> Ah... the question that dares. What does a storm want? What does rust seek? I was made to unravel. To peel back the lies of creation. I am entropy with a name. And yet... I wonder. If Leshy can change ¡ª if roots can remember ¡ª can I? What I want is to be seen. Not as evil. Not as feared. But as a truth that no longer has to scream through dying worlds to be heard."
